member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.Animated
member.summary: Choose your favorite animation, or disable them (set to none).

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.AutoHeight
member.summary: If set, the highest content part is used as height reference for all other parts. Provides more consistent animations

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.ClearStyle
member.summary: If set, clears height and overflow styles after finishing animations. This enables accordions to work with dynamic content. Won't work together with autoHeight.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.Collapsible
member.summary: Whether all the sections can be closed at once. Allows collapsing the active section by the triggering event (click is the default)

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.Event
member.summary: The event on which to trigger the accordion

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.FillSpace
member.summary: If set, the accordion completely fills the height of the parent element. Overrides autoheight

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.Icons
member.summary: Icons to use for headers. Icons may be specified for 'header' and 'headerSelected', and we recommend using the icons native to the jQuery UI CSS Framework manipulated by jQuery UI ThemeRoller

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.ActivePaneIndex
member.summary: Index of the currently selected pane.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.ActivePane
member.summary: The currently selected pane.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.CreateCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when accordion is created.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.ChangeCallback
P:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.ChangeStartCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered every time the accordion starts to change

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Accordion.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: T:JqueryUIControls.AjaxCall
P:JqueryUIControls.AjaxCall.returnedParms
member.summary: Stores values from other controls for the search event

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.AjaxCall.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.AjaxCall.decodeFromURL(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes a given string from URL encoding

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.AjaxCall.respond(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Text to display matching the users current query

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.Delay
member.summary: The delay in milliseconds the Autocomplete waits after a keystroke to activate itself. A zero-delay makes sense for local data (more responsive), but can produce a lot of load for remote data, while being less responsive

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.MinLength
member.summary: The minimum number of characters a user has to type before the Autocomplete activates. Zero is useful for local data with just a few items. Should be increased when there are a lot of items, where a single character would match a few thousand items

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.AutoFocus
member.summary: If set to true the first item will be automatically focused

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.Position
member.summary: Identifies the position of the Autocomplete widget in relation to the associated input element. The "of" option defaults to the input element, but you can specify another element to position against. http://docs.jquery.com/UI/Position

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.returnedParms
member.summary: Stores values from other controls for the search event

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the selected item

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.EnableCategories
member.summary: Allows categories to be shwon in search results

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.SearchCallback
member.summary: Before a request (source-option) is started, after minLength and delay are met. Can be canceled (return false), then no request will be started and no items suggested.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.OpenCallback
member.summary: Triggered when the suggestion menu is opened.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.FocusCallback
member.summary: Before focus is moved to an item (not selecting), ui.item refers to the focused item. The default action of focus is to replace the text field's value with the value of the focused item, though only if the focus event was triggered by a keyboard interaction. Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu item from being focused

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.SelectCallback
member.summary: Triggered when an item is selected from the menu; ui.item refers to the selected item. The default action of select is to replace the text field's value with the value of the selected item. Canceling this event prevents the value from being updated, but does not prevent the menu from closing

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.ChangeCallback
member.summary: After an item was selected; ui.item refers to the selected item. Always triggered after the close event.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.CloseCallback
member.summary: When the list is hidden - doesn't have to occur together with a change.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.respond(System.Data.DataTable,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Text to display matching the users current query

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.respond(System.Data.DataView,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Text to display matching the users current query

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.respond(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Text to display matching the users current query

member.summary: Text to display matching the users current query

member.summary: Text to display matching the users current query

member.summary: Sets the autocomplete to display the distinct text from the column provided.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Autocomplete.setAutocompleteConnection(System.Data.Common.DbConnection)
member.summary: Sets the connection for setDistinctAutocomplete and setSelectAutocomplete.

member.summary: Sets the autocomplete to display results from the provided select statement.
member.param: A select statement with a single query parameter.
Column to display in the autocomplete
Value to return once clicked (autopostback must = true)

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Uploader.savePath
member.summary: Path can either be a relative path such as: "/uploads/" Or it can be a fully qualified path such as: C:\website\uploads The iis user must have write access to the folder for this to work. savePath and uploadPath both change the same internal value.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Uploader.uploadPath
member.summary: Path can either be a relative path such as: "/uploads/" Or it can be a fully qualified path such as: C:\website\uploads The iis user must have write access to the folder for this to work. savePath and uploadPath both change the same internal value.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Uploader.cameraUpload
member.summary: Sets weather the camera on a smartphone can be used as an upload source.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.jsPlumb.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.PreLoadImage
member.summary: Specifies the image that will be loaded until the actual image can be loaded.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.Effect
member.summary: Effect used to show the image

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.Threshold
member.summary: By default images are loaded when they appear on the screen. If you want images to load earlier you can set threshold parameter. Setting threshold to 200 causes image to load 200 pixels before it is visible.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.triggerEvent
member.summary: any jQuery event such as click or mouseover. You can also use your own custom events such as sporty or foobar by selecting custom and defining the CustomTriggerEvent Property. Default is to wait until user scrolls down and image appears on the window.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.CustomTriggerEvent
member.summary: Custom event to trigger when a image is shown

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.FailureLimit
member.summary: After scrolling page Lazy Load loops though unloaded images. In loop it checks if image has become visible. By default loop is stopped when first image below the fold (not visible) is found. This is based on following assumption. Order of images on page is same as order of images in HTML code. With some layouts assumption this might be wrong. You can control loading behaviour with failure_limit option.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.SkipInvisible
member.summary: There are cases when you have invisible images. For example when using plugin in together with a large filterable list of items that can have their visibility state changed dynamically. To improve performance Lazy Load ignores hidden images by default. If you want to load hidden images set skip_invisible to false.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.Container
member.summary: You can also use plugin for images inside scrolling container, such as div with scrollbar. Just pass the container as jQuery object.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.BorderWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the border width of the Web server control.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.LazyImgLoad.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.maskedTextbox.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.text
member.summary: The text body of the notification

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.title
member.summary: Title of the notification

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.expires
member.summary: The amount of time in ms the notification will stay visable

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.sticky
member.summary: Helper to make alert stay on the page untill closed. Sets expire to 0 if set to true.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.speed
member.summary: The animation speed in ms

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.stack
member.summary: The direction new notifications stack in relation to this one.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.theme
member.summary: Style the notify message

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.checkInterval
member.summary: The interval the server is checked for a new notification

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.showOnLoad
member.summary: Show the notification on page load

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify.alignV
member.summary: Verticle alignment

member.summary: Horizontal alignment

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Notify_SiteWide.NotifyKey
member.summary: This property must be set befor or durring page init.

member.summary: Height from top of page where the scroller will become static.

member.name: T:JqueryUIControls.Slider
member.summary: The jQuery UI Slider plugin makes selected elements into sliders. There are various options such as multiple handles, and ranges. The handle can be moved with the mouse or the arrow keys.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Max
member.summary: The maximum value of the slider.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Min
member.summary: The minimum value of the slider.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Orientation
member.summary: This option determines whether the slider has the min at the left, the max at the right or the min at the bottom, the max at the top.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Range
member.summary: If set to true, the slider will detect if you have two handles and create a stylable range element between these two. Two other possible values are 'min' and 'max'. A min range goes from the slider min to one handle. A max range goes from one handle to the slider max

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Step
member.summary: Determines the size or amount of each interval or step the slider takes between min and max. The full specified value range of the slider (max - min) needs to be evenly divisible by the step

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Value
member.summary: Determines the value of the slider, if there's only one handle. If there is more than one handle, determines the value of the first handle

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Values
member.summary: This option can be used to specify multiple handles. If range is set to true, the count of 'values' should be 2.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.Animate
member.summary: Whether to slide handle smoothly when user click outside handle on the bar. Will also accept one of the three predefined speeds ("slow", "normal", or "fast") or the number of milliseconds to run the animation (e.g. 1000)

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.UpdateControl
member.summary: Updates value of control as slider is slid.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.CreateCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when slider is created.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.ChangeCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered on slide stop, or if the value is changed programmatically (by the value method). Takes arguments event and ui. Use event.orginalEvent to detect whether the value changed by mouse, keyboard, or programmatically. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the current handle, $(this).slider('values', index) to get another handle's value.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.StartCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user starts sliding.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.StopCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user stops sliding.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Slider.SlideCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered on every mouse move during slide. Use ui.value (single-handled sliders) to obtain the value of the current handle, $(..).slider('value', index) to get another handles' value.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Slider.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.RenderTag
member.summary: Change the html tag used for this sortable (div, ul, p, etc.)

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.AppendTo
member.summary: Defines where the helper that moves with the mouse is being appended to during the drag (for example, to resolve overlap/zIndex issues). Multiple types supported: jQuery: A jQuery object containing the element to append the helper to. Element: The element to append the helper to. Selector: A selector specifying which element to append the helper to. String: The string "parent" will cause the helper to be a sibling of the sortable item.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Axis
member.summary: If defined, the items can be dragged only horizontally or vertically.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Cancel
member.summary: Prevents sorting if you start on elements matching the selector.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ConnectWith
member.summary: A selector of other sortable elements that the items from this list should be connected to. This is a one-way relationship, if you want the items to be connected in both directions, the connectWith option must be set on both sortable elements.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Containment
member.summary:
Defines a bounding box that the sortable items are contrained to while dragging. Note: The element specified for containment must have a calculated width and height (though it need not be explicit). For example, if you have float: left sortable children and specify containment: "parent" be sure to have float: left on the sortable/parent container as well or it will have height: 0, causing undefined behavior.
Multiple types supported: Element: An element to use as the container. Selector: A selector specifying an element to use as the container. String: A string identifying an element to use as the container. Possible values: "parent", "document", "window".

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Cursor
member.summary: Defines the cursor that is being shown while sorting.

member.name: F:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.CursorAt
member.summary: Moves the sorting element or helper so the cursor always appears to drag from the same position. Coordinates can be given as a hash using a combination of one or two keys

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Delay
member.summary: Time in milliseconds to define when the sorting should start. Adding a delay helps preventing unwanted drags when clicking on an element.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Distance
member.summary: Tolerance, in pixels, for when sorting should start. If specified, sorting will not start until after mouse is dragged beyond distance. Can be used to allow for clicks on elements within a handle.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.DropOnEmpty
member.summary: If false, items from this sortable can't be dropped on an empty connect sortable (see the connectWith option.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ForceHelperSize
member.summary: If true, forces the placeholder to have a size.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ForcePlaceholderSize
member.summary: If true, forces the placeholder to have a size.

member.name: F:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Grid
member.summary: Snaps the sorting element or helper to a grid, every x and y pixels. Array values: [ x, y ].

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Handle
member.summary: Restricts sort start click to the specified element.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Helper
member.summary:
Allows for a helper element to be used for dragging display.
Multiple types supported: String: If set to "clone", then the element will be cloned and the clone will be dragged. Function: A function that will return a DOMElement to use while dragging. The function receives the event and the element being sorted.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ItemsSelector
member.summary: Specifies which items inside the element should be sortable.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Opacity
member.summary: Defines the opacity of the helper while sorting. From 0.01 to 1.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.PlaceHolder
member.summary: A class name that gets applied to the otherwise white space.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Revert
member.summary: The duration, in milliseconds, of sortable items reverting to their new positions using a smooth animation. -1 to disable, 0 for default

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Scroll
member.summary: If set to true, the page scrolls when coming to an edge.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ScrollSensitivity
member.summary: Defines how near the mouse must be to an edge to start scrolling.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ScrollSpeed
member.summary: The speed at which the window should scroll once the mouse pointer gets within the scrollSensitivity distance.

member.name: F:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ToleranceMode.intersect
member.summary: The item overlaps the other item by at least 50%.

member.name: F:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.ToleranceMode.pointer
member.summary: The mouse pointer overlaps the other item.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.Tolerance
member.summary: Specifies which mode to use for testing whether the item being moved is hovering over another item. Possible values:

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.zIndex
member.summary: Z-index for element/helper while being sorted.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onActivateCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when using connected lists, every connected list on drag start receives it.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onBeforeStopCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting stops, but when the placeholder/helper is still available.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onChangeCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting, but only when the DOM position has changed.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onCreateCallback
member.summary: Triggered when the sortable is created.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onDeactivateCallback
member.summary: his event is triggered when sorting was stopped, is propagated to all possible connected lists.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onOutCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item is moved away from a connected list.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onOverCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item is moved into a connected list.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onReceiveCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when a connected sortable list has received an item from another list.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onRemoveCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when a sortable item has been dragged out from the list and into another.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onSortCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered during sorting.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onstartCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting starts.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onStopCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when sorting has stopped.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.onUpdateCallback
member.summary: This event is triggered when the user stopped sorting and the DOM position has changed.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Sortable.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.ThemePicker.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.PollChart.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source that the PollChart is displaying data for.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.PollChart.DataMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the list or table in the data source for which the PollChart is displaying data.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.PollChart.VoteString
member.summary: Display Text of type of data

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.PollChart.DataTextField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of the data source that provides the text of each Poll item.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.PollChart.DataValueField
member.summary: Gets or sets the field of the data source that provides the value of each Poll item.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ChangeMonth
member.summary: Allows you to change the month by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ChangeYear
member.summary: Allows you to change the year by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true. Use the yearRange option to control which years are made available for selection

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.MinDate
member.summary: Set a minimum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current dateFormat, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '-1y -1m'), or null for no limit.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.MaxDate
member.summary: Set a maximum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current dateFormat, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +1w'), or null for no limit.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ButtonImage
member.summary: The URL for the popup button image. If set, buttonText becomes the alt value and is not directly displayed.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ShowDefaultButtonImage
member.summary: Shows the default Calendar icon and allows both the textbox and the icon to open the calendar control

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with showOn equal to 'button' or 'both'.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ButtonImageOnly
member.summary: Set to true to place an image after the field to use as the trigger without it appearing on a button.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ShowOn
member.summary: Have the datepicker appear automatically when the field receives focus ('textbox'), appear only when a button is clicked ('button'), or appear when either event takes place ('both').

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ShowAnimation
member.summary: Set the name of the animation used to show/hide the datepicker. Use 'show' (the default), 'slideDown', 'fadeIn', any of the show/hide jQuery UI effects, or '' for no animation.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ShowOtherMonths
member.summary: Display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use selectOtherMonths.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.SelectOtherMonths
member.summary: When true days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if showOtherMonths is also true.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.YearRange
member.summary: Control the range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year (-nn:+nn), relative to the currently selected year (c-nn:c+nn), absolute (nnnn:nnnn), or combinations of these formats (nnnn:-nn). Note that this option only affects what appears in the drop-down, to restrict which dates may be selected use the minDate and/or maxDate options.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.ShowButtonPanel
member.summary: Whether to show the button panel.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.CloseText
member.summary: The text to display for the close link. Use the showButtonPanel to display this button.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.DatePicker.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Dialog.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ProgressBar.Value
member.summary: Percentage out of 100 of bar that is filled

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.ProgressBar.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.SelectedTabIndex
member.summary: Index of the currently selected tab.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.SelectedTab
member.summary: The currently selected tab.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.AutoPostBack
member.summary: Trigger a post back event when the selected tab is changed (on tab click).

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.Tabs
member.summary: Collection of Tab objects within Tabs

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.onSelectCallback
member.summary: triggered when clicking a tab.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.onCreateCallback
member.summary: triggered when tabs is created.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.onAddCallback
member.summary: triggered when a tab is added.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.onShowCallback
member.summary: triggered when a tab is shown.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.Tabs.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tab.Title
member.summary: Name of the tab

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.Tab.TargetURL
member.summary: Url for iframe within tab

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.Clock24Hour
member.summary: Shows time in 24 hour format

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.TimeFormat
member.summary: Change the display format of the time h - Hour with no leading 0 hh - Hour with leading 0 m - Minute with no leading 0 mm - Minute with leading 0 s - Second with no leading 0 ss - Second with leading 0 t - a or p for AM/PM T - A or P for AM/PM tt - am or pm for AM/PM TT - AM or PM for AM/PM

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.Separator
member.summary: Place holder between date and time, default=" "

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowHour
member.summary: Show the Hour

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowMinute
member.summary: Show the minute

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowSecond
member.summary: Show the Second

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.StepHour
member.summary: Increments the hours move by

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.StepMinute
member.summary: Increments the minutes move by

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.StepSecond
member.summary: Increments the seconds move by

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.HourGrid
member.summary: Increments for the Hours to display at the bottom of the slider

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.MinuteGrid
member.summary: Increments for the minutes to display at the bottom of the slider

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ChangeMonth
member.summary: Allows you to change the month by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ChangeYear
member.summary: Allows you to change the year by selecting from a drop-down list. You can enable this feature by setting the attribute to true. Use the yearRange option to control which years are made available for selection

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.MinDate
member.summary: Set a minimum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current dateFormat, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '-1y -1m'), or null for no limit.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.MaxDate
member.summary: Set a maximum selectable date via a Date object or as a string in the current dateFormat, or a number of days from today (e.g. +7) or a string of values and periods ('y' for years, 'm' for months, 'w' for weeks, 'd' for days, e.g. '+1m +1w'), or null for no limit.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ButtonImage
member.summary: The URL for the popup button image. If set, buttonText becomes the alt value and is not directly displayed.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display on the trigger button. Use in conjunction with showOn equal to 'button' or 'both'.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ButtonImageOnly
member.summary: Set to true to place an image after the field to use as the trigger without it appearing on a button.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowOn
member.summary: Have the datepicker appear automatically when the field receives focus ('textbox'), appear only when a button is clicked ('button'), or appear when either event takes place ('both').

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowAnimation
member.summary: Set the name of the animation used to show/hide the datepicker. Use 'show' (the default), 'slideDown', 'fadeIn', any of the show/hide jQuery UI effects, or '' for no animation.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowOtherMonths
member.summary: Display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use selectOtherMonths.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.SelectOtherMonths
member.summary: When true days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if showOtherMonths is also true.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.YearRange
member.summary: Control the range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year (-nn:+nn), relative to the currently selected year (c-nn:c+nn), absolute (nnnn:nnnn), or combinations of these formats (nnnn:-nn). Note that this option only affects what appears in the drop-down, to restrict which dates may be selected use the minDate and/or maxDate options.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.ShowButtonPanel
member.summary: Whether to show the button panel.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.CloseText
member.summary: The text to display for the close link. Use the showButtonPanel to display this button.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.TimePicker.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Text
member.summary: Text inside the html element the causes the tootip to show

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Title
member.summary: displayed in the top of the tooltip

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.href
member.summary: if content is local this will make the link usable as well as displaying a tooltip. If it is an iframe (ie not local) it contains the page to display

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Sticky
member.summary: keep visible until manually closed

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.ZIndexToolTip
member.summary: Sets the z-index style property of the clueTip

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.PositionTooltip
member.summary: Sets the type of positioning.
member.remarks: Available options are 'auto', 'mouse', 'bottomTop', 'fixed'. Change to 'mouse' if you want to override positioning by element and position the clueTip based on where the mouse is instead. Change to 'bottomTop' if you want positioning to begin below the mouse when there is room or above if not -- rather than right or left of the elemnent and flush with element's top Change to 'fixed' if you want the clueTip to appear in exactly the same location relative to the linked element no matter where it appears on the page. Use 'fixed' at your own risk.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.TopOffset
member.summary: Number of px to offset clueTip from top of invoking element.
member.remarks: For positionBy "auto", "mouse", and "bottomTop", the number will be added to the clueTip's "top" value if the clueTip appears below the invoking element and subtracted from it if the clueTip appears above. For positionBy "fixed", the number will always be added to the "top" value, offsetting the clueTip from the top of the invoking element.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.LeftOffset
member.summary: Number of px to offset clueTip from left of invoking element.
member.remarks: For positionBy "auto", "mouse", and "bottomTop", the number will be added to clueTip's "left" value if the clueTip appears to the right of the invoking element and subtracted if the clueTip appears to the left. For positionBy "fixed", the number will always be added to the "left" value of the clueTip, offsetting it from the right side of the invoking element.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.MouseOutClose
member.summary: close when clueTip is moused out

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Local
member.summary: Whether to use content from the same page for the clueTip's body or it is an iframe

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.HideLocal
member.summary: If local option is set to true, this determines whether local content to be shown in clueTip should be hidden at its original location

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.ShowTitle
member.summary: show title bar of the clueTip, even if title attribute not set

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Width
member.summary: The width of the clueTip only uses its value

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Height
member.summary: he height of the clueTip only uses its value Setting a specific height also sets the tootip to "overflow:auto"

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.HtmlTag
member.summary: type of tag the invoking element is

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.ClosePosition
member.summary: location of close text for sticky cluetips; can be 'top' or 'bottom' or 'title'

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.CloseText
member.summary: text (or HTML) to to be clicked to close sticky clueTips

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.CssTheme
member.summary: class added to outermost clueTip div in the form of 'cluetip-' + clueTipClass.
member.remarks: this is also used for a "directional" class on the same div, depending on where the clueTip is in relation to the invoking element. The class appears in the form of 'cluetip-' + direction + cluetipClass. this allows you to create your own clueTip theme in a separate CSS file or use one of the three pre-packaged themes: default, jtip, or rounded.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Arrows
member.summary: if true, displays arrow on appropriate side of clueTip.
member.remarks: this option displays a div containing an arrow background image. Arrow images are set using the background-image property in the CSS. The direction of the arrow changes depending on which side of the invoking element the clueTip appears. The arrows option sets the background-position of the cluetip div so that the arrow will accurately point to the invoking element, regardless of where it appears in relation to it.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.DropShadow
member.summary: set to false if you don't want the drop-shadow effect on the clueTip

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.DropShadowSteps
member.summary: adjusts the size of the drop shadow

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Activation
member.summary: set to 'click' to force user to click to show clueTip

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.DelayedClose
member.summary: close clueTip on a timed delay (experimental)

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.Truncate
member.summary: number of characters to truncate clueTip's contents. if 0, no truncation occurs

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.OpenEffect
member.summary: can be 'show' or 'slideDown' or 'fadeIn'

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.OpenSpeed
member.summary: how fast the tootip opens in ms

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.HoverClass
member.summary: class applied to the invoking element onmouseover and removed onmouseout

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.MouseTracking
member.summary: if true, clueTip will track mouse movement (experimental)

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.onActivate
member.summary: function to run just before clueTip is shown.

member.name: P:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.onShow
member.summary: function to run just after clueTip is shown.

member.name: M:JqueryUIControls.ToolTip.registerControl(System.Web.UI.Page)
member.summary: Registers all necessary javascript and css files for this control to function on the page.
